Description: Along with PPL Montana (a subsidiary of PPL Corp.), Portland General Electric Co., Avista Corp. and PacifiCorp,  Puget Sound Energy was one of five owners of Montana's Colstrip power plant that agreed to pay $25 million to settle a lawsuit alleging that the plant was contaminating the town's water supply. Details on how much each defendant would pay were not made public, but PPL and Avita disclosed that their shares totaled $10 million. Here we assumed the other $14.9 million was divided equally between Puget Sound, Portland General Electrical and PacifiCorp.
Natural gas pipeline safety rule violations
Fraudulent actions of PSE contractor employees in falsifying pipeline leak inspection records
Gas leak caused explosion injuring homeowners and damaging home.
Violations resulting from natural gas incident at a residential address
